app.components.Tooltip.occurrenceIntro: Distribution areas of ecosystem functional groups have been classified as major or minor occurrences
app.components.Tooltip.occurrence_major: Major occurrences are areas where an ecosystem functional group is very likely to occur
app.components.Tooltip.occurrence_minor: Minor occurrences are areas where an ecosystem functional group is scattered in patches within matrices of other ecosystem functional groups or where they occur in substantial areas but only within a segment of a larger region

app.containers.Map.drawTooltipRectangleS: Click and drag to draw rectangular area
app.containers.Map.drawTooltipRemove: Click on area, then 'Save' to delete area
app.containers.RouteAnalyse.awaitResults: Retrieving list of ecosystem groups... Especially for large areas this may take a while.
app.containers.RouteAnalyse.defineAreaFi: A comma-separated list of points, each consisting of two space-separated values in decimal degrees where the first value represents the point's latitude and the second value its longitude (format: 'lon1 lat1,lon2 lat2,[...],lon3 lat3'). Note that the last point must equal the first point to 'close' the resulting shape.
app.containers.RouteAnalyse.defineAreaIn: Draw an area on the map or enter area coordinates
app.containers.RouteAnalyse.download: For additional analyses you can download the raw data from the {link}.
app.containers.RouteAnalyse.hintResultsA: Note that the retrieved list is intended to be indicative only.
app.containers.RouteAnalyse.hintResultsG: Bars showing % of global occurrence for each type
app.containers.RouteAnalyse.hintResultsR: Note that the retrieved list is intended to be indicative only. Further note that the area calculation is still experimental and has some limitations.
app.containers.RouteAnalyse.intro: Retrieve an indicative list of ecosystem functional groups for a given area.

app.containers.RouteExploreOverview.teas: Start by selecting a Realm of interest, then drill down to learn more about its Biomes and Ecosystem Functional Groups
app.containers.RouteExploreOverview.titl: Explorar la Tipología Global de Ecosistemas
app.containers.RouteHome.introParagraph: La Tipología de Ecosistemas Globales de la UICN es un marco de clasificación integral de los ecosistemas de la Tierra que integra sus características funcionales y de composición. Esta tipología ha sido adoptada por numerosas instituciones internacionales para ayudar a identificar los ecosistemas que son más críticos para la conservación de la biodiversidad, la investigación, la gestión y para asegurar el bienestar humano en el futuro.
app.containers.RouteHome.linkAboutMethod: Obtenga más información sobre los métodos
app.containers.RouteHome.linkAboutSite: Obtenga más información sobre este sitio
app.containers.RouteHome.teaserSectionAb: Este sitio es una introducción a la Tipología Global de Ecosistemas de la UICN
app.containers.RouteHome.teaserSectionAn: Identificar la presencia de grupos funcionales por país o área personalizada
app.containers.RouteHome.teaserSectionEx: Comience seleccionando una División de interés, luego navege para obtener más información sobre sus Biomas y Grupos Funcionales de Ecosistemas
app.containers.RouteHome.titleSectionExp: Explorar la Tipología Global de Ecosistemas
